result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tommy J Ehrisman

records.addlTxt: for Examination under 971.16 Wis. Stats. (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect)
Hearing on December 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:44 AM Defendant Tommy J Ehrisman appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Tommy J Ehrisman.  Attorney Craig Lambert in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Kryshak states that defendant wishes to enter not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect plea.
Court questions defendant.
Court orders that defendant will be examined by doctor from Wisconsin Forensic Unit and doctor to submit report to the Court.
Adjourned plea hearing on October 10, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on August 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:19 PM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tommy J Ehrisman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Tommy J Ehrisman. 
Dean Fleisner is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. He is a sergeant with the Wisconsin Rapids Police Department. On 2/16/22, he was dispatched to a residence in the City of Wisconsin Rapids regarding a disturbance. He spoke to defendant who indicated that he put a pillow over his wife's face with the intention of ending her life. He stated it was due to financial and medical problems. Officer Krummel spoke to alleged victim and she indicated that defendant told her that he had thoughts of smothering her with a pillow for a couple of days and on this day he did attempt to. He did stop and instructed her to call the police. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. Attorney Kryshak cross-examines witness.  
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Not guilty plea. Bond is continued.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on April 5, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
for New Preliminary Hearing
Court appoints Gary Kryshak as counsel. Must make initial payment of $1,000.00 and $100.00 per month commencing 4/1/22.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
11:33 AM Defendant Tommy J Ehrisman in court, in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tommy J Ehrisman appeared by video means.
Court questions defendant regarding non-representation. He states he does not qualify for Public Defender and he cannot afford counsel. Court advises him to fill out a petition for appointment of counsel. Court will proceed with preliminary hearing today.
Dean Fleisner is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. He is a sargeant with the Wisconsin Rapids Police Department. On 2/16/22, he was dispatched to a residence in the City of Wisconsin Rapids regarding a domestic incident. He met with defendant and he stated he put a pillow over his wife's face and intended to kill her. He stopped and asked his wife to call the police. Officer Krummel spoke to the alleged victim. She indicated that she woke to a pillow over her face and had diffcult breathing. The defendant told her that he had been planning to do this for a couple of days. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. 
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bound over for further proceedings. Bond is continued.  Arraignment scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on March 2, 2022 at 11:30 am.
01:33 PM Defendant Tommy J Ehrisman in court, in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tommy J Ehrisman appeared by video means.
No contact with AEE or residence. Take all meds as prescribed. 22-2284 $200,000
Defendant appeared by video from Wood County Jail.
No contact with alleged victim, A.E.E., or residence. Take medication as prescribed.
